title: So Season 6 Will Be The Marksmen Meta
body:
From all the things going on:

* Many Marksmen are getting reworks/buffs
* Tanks are easily killable thanks to the new itemization, decreased cost of {{item:3035}} , plus the crazy amount of %HP true damage {{champion:114}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:67}} 
* {{champion:133}} changes making her go mid lane
* The addition of marksmen in the jungle {{champion:203}} 

Since they officially destroyed the "tank meta", ADCs no longer need to worry about a wall in the way. 

Anyone can duel anyone

replies.body:
Let's get one thing straight here: Nearly every season so far has been a marksman meta. Your team comp will 99% of the time contain a marksman of some sort, and it's been that way since season 1. They are not optional like other roles.

Tanks come and go.
Assassins come and go.
Mages come and go.
Bruisers come and go.
Fighters come and go.
Marksman are forever.

I was just going to comment this. League is an ADC game. The other roles are determined by how they interact with the adc. What makes an assassin strong? Its ability to kill and stop adc. What makes a tanks strong? the ability to cc and negate adc damage. What makes a jungler strong? the ability to either get the adc fed, stop the enemy adc, or get a champ that can kill the adc fed (its why lee is good he can duel and assassinate adcs), supports? obvious. Top? How much a threat you can be while adc shreds the enemy. What makes an adc good? suvivability, sieging, drag/baron control (basically everything).

Here's my biggest gripe. ADCs are ALWAYS meta. ALWAYS. So why does an adc Kalista get the unlimited baron damage ability. As an adc she is already extremely important to taking the objective. What about Trist bomb thing that she sieges with. An ADC is already the best at taking towers. Why can't we get those mechanics on other roles and give them a little more power and control. It fucking baffles me and a lot of times pisses me off.
Lol go play Dota and then complain about a game where your team has 1 carry and 4 supports xD

> [{quoted}](name=The Ellimiist,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Akk4xZXh,comment-id=000100020000,timestamp=2015-10-30T01:35:52.025+0000)
>
> Lol go play Dota and then complain about a game where your team has 1 carry and 4 supports xD

The problem: in DOTA, even a 0-10 support can delete a ranged carry with their base damage alone until late game (though not melee carries).

In league, you just get kited and die even if you are a "melee carry".

I agree.  There are ways other roles can take on the strengths of an adc, but they are so far out of the way, and so weak that it's rarely worth it.

Mages can take lich bane to hit towers harder than an adc can.  Except that only happens at 3+ items...  ADC still get the early push even if a mage can end the game as good.

Azir has his soldiers secondary cast ability where he hits towers, but it's not that great really.  It's just too weak.  Heimer turrets can also hit towers, but like Azir it's a bit weak to consider viable.

I think this is one of the biggest things they could add to Morde to really make him an adc replacement.  Have Q able to damage structures.  This way when you finally do get some tower time it really counts, like Nasus.

It would be nice if they gave ways non-adc could pressure turrets more smoothly through the game.

Sure, now it looks like it might be time for some change in the air. The problem is, [when somebody actually suggests it](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/YtskWWlX-cut-morde-some-slack), it suddenly becomes an unpopular idea.

The thing I don't understand is that while most people [_don't_ seem to like playing the ranged carry](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/q8IEuAnN-playing-adc-is-suffering), nobody really struggles to shift the meta. Bruiser bot could actually be a thing, but if there is one thing I have to agree with Riot on, it's that some people seriously dislike change.

_Btw, for those who are interested, it's the second time this month already I'm linking a [Mark Rosewater article](http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/making-magic/themata-2015-10-26). If you are interested in game design, make sure you don't miss it, as it ties indirectly to the topic being discussed here._

SR gameplay revolves around pushing towers (or other structures). Ranged carries are generally the best at pushing towers, due to having AD/range/AS. That's why they've been entrenched in SR meta for ages. Running a bruiser bot is a possibility, but without a pushing/sieging tool like Morde's ghost dragon, it's difficult to (quickly) take a contested tower.

Or just....putting a marksman elsewhere. Varus/Ez/Corki/New Quinn/maybe kog are all viable mid laners where you can still have the ranged seige potential and have a more or less tanky comp with your bruisers bot. The only downside to this is you will typically lack a mage and wave clear (unless it is Varus or Quinn depending on how well that new Q can clear waves). People hate change but there are quite a few supports that do work well with melee characters (Karma/Zilean/Lulu all give good speed buffs and can contribute late game wave clear aswell while Blitz/Naut/TK can fulfill a more kill lane approach to a bruiser bot).

Thank you for your civilised response, it's much better when somebody explains his/her opinion instead of "bruisers bot sucks". :)

I can understand why ADCs remain the single mandatory role for every composition. What I just don't get is why so many people keep complaining about it without proposing anything creative. Perhaps it's a fight that cannot be won, but why not at least try?

Melee carries usually have stronger AD/AS steroids, since they don't have range.
And they have no trouble pushing thanks to Ravenous Hydra.

Sieging is a different story, but if people were dedicated to learning it as a meta I'm sure it would be effective. Especially since when the game started, Siege oriented Mids like Azir and Ziggs weren't in the game to pick up the slack, nor was Hydra, or pushing tools like Banner of Command, Rot Portal, or Ohmwrecker (those items no-body builds).

I feel like the tools are there, and the payoff might be decent if a team were coordinated enough. Look at Olaf's kit for instance; he gets 1% attack speed per 1% missing health, an Additional 80% attack speed for free off of his W, and he has an ability that does scaling true damage, that's cooldown_ is reduced by autoattacks_. If a team was built around letting him build damage items, he'd mulch teams and towers.

But melee carries ARE NOT SAFE, and so will never see pro play, and pros are the best players, so most wont bother practicing a strat the best players don't use.

I think it's significantly underexplored.

Cannot stress this more.  ADC are the best objective takers.  People talk about crazy bot lane combos that "destroy lane" and never seem to get the problem is that late game short of a team ace you have no way to siege towers even if you're ahead if the other team has reasonable wave clear.

Needing an adc isn't about winning lane it's about winning game.  You have to be significantly farther ahead to take (defended) towers with no adc than you do with one.
